labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Consider including a=fingerprint mechanism in a p2p SDP example
issues.author: SpencerDawkins
issues.body:
From @juberti on AVTCORE mailing list: 

> For c2s use, the SDP you have outlined should work well. For p2p usage, we should include the a=fingerprint mechanism used in https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5763 to allow validation of self-signed peer certs.

issues.title: Consider including a=tls-id in SDP
issues.author: SpencerDawkins
issues.body:
From @juberti, on the AVTCORE mailing list: 

> It would probably be a good idea for the SDP to include a=tls-id, defined in https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8842, to ensure endpoints can tell when the security handshake is being restarted, as discussed in the cited RFC. This would probably obivate the need for a=connection:new as well (which is not typically used in DTLS-SRTP).

issues.title: Check QUIC impacts on BUNDLE
issues.author: SpencerDawkins
issues.body: From @cdh4u - Please remember to check whether there are any BUNDLE impacts. Section 9 of BUNDLE contains RTP considerations for BUNDLE, so I suggest to check whether there is anything that needs to be updated/modified for QUIC usage.
